8. I was sure it was finally my time. Then Monday arrived. First, Sanford-Pillsbury called. They said DreamWorks LOVED my script but "already had something similar in development" so they had to pass.

6. I got to Gary Busey's house still high from the excitment that "Wish" was being considered by DreamWorks that weekend. Gary and I sat on his deck with a view of PCH and the ocean. He fetched lemonade for us from the kitchen.

5. As I drove to Malibu via Topanga Canyon, my cell phone rang. It was my attorney. Sanford-Pillsbury called him to get my consent to submit "Wish" for the DreamWorks weekend read because they had a deal. Phone coverage in the canyon was spotty. I had to find a spot to pull over.
